body.para: On Saturday 19 October 2002 14:57, Hendrik vom Lehn wrote:

quote.quotepara: On Saturday 19 October 2002 14:11, Kevin Krammer wrote:
Could you please give an example for what you would need that?

It's for an mldonkey kio-slave which should add ed2k:// links. In windows you click on the link and it's added to edonkey, but you stay on the page which you are on. So it's possible to add several links with javascript automaticially. I tried to put a history.back() in the html code, but then the javascript adding doesn't work.
If an error occurs the user could be notified with an MessageBox, for example, but in normal case the page you are on should stay.

body.para: For that you don't need an ioslave, you can just use a protocol handler (look at the existing ones for telnet and mailto ($KDEDIRS/share/services/telnet.protocol IIRC). I've been using such a handler with ed2k links that passed the request over the LAN to the box where the donkey was running and a listener app would notify it to add the link. Worked fine :-) -Malte
